title: Turkish Paneer with Polenta & Courgette
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and carrots with smoked paprika + cumin 7 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Toss green beans and garlic with half the butter, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season salmon fillet and place on the tray. Roast for 53 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Indonesian Tempeh with Sweet potato & Broccoli
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 200°C.
Toss broccoli and mushrooms with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season tempeh and place on the tray. Air-fry for 31 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Basque Protein Egg Bites with Cabbage
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix eggs with ras el hanout and a pinch of salt.
Layer with cabbage, onion and pitta.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Halloumi Smoked paprika + cumin plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook halloumi 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry aubergine and peas with smoked paprika + cumin 31 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tempeh Harissa bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tempeh 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and asparagus with harissa 7 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Turkey breast Ras el hanout plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook turkey breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry kale and green beans with ras el hanout 27 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Paneer Thai green curry paste bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry carrots and garlic with thai green curry paste 10 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
